title: Add downloadable INOVICS corporate presentation deck (Option 1 theme)

requirements.text: Create a 14-slide INOVICS corporate presentation deck as a PowerPoint (.pptx) using the exact slide-by-slide content provided in the conversation, and apply Option 1 styling aligned to the existing website theme (dark navy background + yellow accent, clean enterprise look, bold headings, minimal bullet points, abstract data/grid visuals, and no stock/cheesy imagery or heavy icons).

quotes: Can you generate a Powerpoint based on same theme and elements with above content
keep it similar to the website we generated

acceptanceCriteria: A .pptx file is produced that contains 14 slides matching the provided titles and body text (Slide 1 through Slide 14).
The deck uses a dark navy background and yellow accent consistent with the site’s palette (navy/charcoal + accent yellow), with a clean enterprise layout.
Slides avoid stock handshake imagery, avoid heavy icon usage, and use abstract/data/grid-style visuals where visuals are needed.
Typography hierarchy is consistent across slides (large bold headings, readable body text, spacing aligned to a coherent grid).

requirements.text: Expose the generated PowerPoint deck as a static downloadable asset from the web app (place the .pptx under the frontend public assets) and add a clearly labeled download entry point in the UI so users can download it directly from the site.

quotes: Can you generate a Powerpoint based on same theme and elements with above content

acceptanceCriteria: The .pptx is available as a static file in the frontend (served without requiring backend calls).
A user can click a “Download Corporate Deck (PPTX)” (or equivalent English label) in the UI and the browser downloads the .pptx successfully.
The download link works in production build (not only in dev).

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend must remain single-actor; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Converting the site’s OKLCH colors to hex codes.
Adding third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Implementing external integrations (CRM/ERP APIs) referenced in slide content.
